summary.p: Will respond to the first letter when he returns Bullinger's treatise on predestination; Thomas [Blarer] has read it, now it is in the hands of [Konrad Zwick]. He is satisfied with the second letter concerning Alexander [Schmutz] and hopes to be able to prevent him from leaving his congregation. Fondly remembers [the spa treatment in] Urdorf. Greetings.

div.p: I will respond to the previous letters, dearest brother, when I return your treatise on predestination, which will happen shortly. Thomas has read it, it is now in the hands of my brother, and then I will also receive it.

In the later letters, I am very pleased with what concerns Alexander. When he recently returned from Strasbourg, I defeated all his arguments in front of the brothers. Whether he will comply, I do not know, but I will leave nothing undone. For I greatly detest the desertion of churches. More on other matters soon.
Oh, how often I think of how well we lived in Urdorf. It will never be as good in my lifetime.
Greet your wife and mother for me, yes, everyone. And may God be with you all.
To the most distinguished man, Heinrich Bullinger, most worthy Antistes of the church in Zurich, his well-deserving brother.
